trans-unit.source: Activity: Animation and patterns
trans-unit.target: アクティビティ: Animation and patterns

trans-unit.source: Guide the students to create programs using coordinates and LEDs.
trans-unit.target: Guide 生徒たち to create programs using coordinates and LEDs.

trans-unit.source: Each of these short exercises demonstrates how to use coordinates to control the LEDs.
trans-unit.target: Each of these short exercises demonstrates how to use coordinates to control the LEDs.

trans-unit.source: These programs can then be modified and used in the students’ more complex projects.
trans-unit.target: These programs can then be modified and used in 生徒たち’ more complex projects.

trans-unit.source: Smile animation - A short exercise in plotting and toggling LEDs to create a simple animation.
trans-unit.target: Smile animation - A short exercise in plotting and toggling LEDs to create a simple animation.

trans-unit.source: Random Patterns generator - A short exercise using a loop to generate random LED patterns and then checking the status of a specific LED.
trans-unit.target: Random Patterns generator - A short exercise using a loop to generate random LED patterns and then checking the status of a specific LED.

trans-unit.source: Brightness - A short exercise in using the brightness settings for the micro:bit LEDs.
trans-unit.target: Brightness - A short exercise in using the brightness settings for the micro:bit LEDs.

trans-unit.source: Smile animation
trans-unit.target: Smile animation

trans-unit.source: A short exercise in plotting and toggling LEDs to create a simple animation.
trans-unit.target: A short exercise in plotting and toggling LEDs to create a simple animation.

trans-unit.source: Though students can use the 'show leds' block for images and animation, there is another way to tell the micro:bit what LEDs to turn on and off using coordinates.
trans-unit.target: Though students can use the 「LEDに表示（show leds）」 block for images and animation, there is another way to tell the micro:bit what LEDs to turn on and off using coordinates.

trans-unit.source: We can still use the 'show leds' block to plan which LED coordinates to turn on
trans-unit.target: We can still use the 「LEDに表示（show leds）」 block to plan which LED coordinates to turn on

trans-unit.source: Drag out a couple 'show leds' blocks from the Basic Toolbox drawer.
trans-unit.target: Drag out a couple 「LEDに表示（show leds）」 blocks from the 基本（Basic）メニュー.

trans-unit.source: Create a smiling face and a non-smiling face.
trans-unit.target: Create a smiling face and a non-smiling face.

trans-unit.source: From the LED Toolbox drawer, drag out 6 'plot x y' blocks.
trans-unit.target: From the LEDメニュー, drag out 6 「点灯 x y（plot x y）」 blocks.

trans-unit.source: Tip: you can also right-click on a block and select Duplicate to copy blocks
trans-unit.target: Tip: you can also right-click on ブロック and select Duplicate to copy blocks

trans-unit.source: Have the students compare the two face images and determine which LEDs are on in both images.
trans-unit.target: Have 生徒たち compare the two face images and determine which LEDs are on in both images.

trans-unit.source: Plot these LEDs using the correct (x,y) coordinates.
trans-unit.target: Plot these LEDs using the correct (x,y) coordinates.

trans-unit.source: When done, place these 'plot x y' blocks inside an 'on start' block.
trans-unit.target: When done, place these 「点灯 x y（plot x y）」 blocks inside an 「最初だけ（on start）」 block.

trans-unit.source: led.plot(1, 0) led.plot(3, 0) led.plot(2, 1) led.plot(1, 3) led.plot(2, 3) led.plot(3, 3)
trans-unit.target: led.plot(1, 0) led.plot(3, 0) led.plot(2, 1) led.plot(1, 3) led.plot(2, 3) led.plot(3, 3)

trans-unit.source: Now we can code for the 4 LEDs that change back and forth, on and off, as we switch from one face to the other and back again over and over.
trans-unit.target: Now we can code for the 4 LEDs that change back and forth, on and off, as we switch from one face to the other and back again over and over.

trans-unit.source: From the LED Toolbox drawer, drag out 4 'toggle x y' blocks.
trans-unit.target: From the LEDメニュー, drag out 4 「反転 x y（toggle x y）」 blocks.

trans-unit.source: Replace the default values with the correct (x,y) coordinates. The 'toggle x y' block will change the status of an LED from on to off or off to on.
trans-unit.target: Replace the default values with the correct (x,y) coordinates. The 「反転 x y（toggle x y）」 block will change the status of an LED from on to off or off to on.

trans-unit.source: Place these 4 'toggle x y' blocks in a 'forever' block.
trans-unit.target: Place these 4 「反転 x y（toggle x y）」 blocks in a 「ずっと（forever）」 block.

trans-unit.source: Place the two 'toggle x y' blocks that create the smile first, followed by the two 'toggle x y' blocks for the non-smile.
trans-unit.target: Place the two 「反転 x y（toggle x y）」 blocks that create the smile first, followed by the two 「反転 x y（toggle x y）」 blocks for the non-smile.

trans-unit.source: You may notice that the toggling happens too quickly. Let’s slow it down a bit by placing a 'pause' block between the two pairs of 'toggle x y' blocks. Set the pause value to 250 milliseconds.
trans-unit.target: You may notice that the toggling happens too quickly. Let’s slow it down a bit by placing a 「一時停止（pause）」 block between the two pairs of 「反転 x y（toggle x y）」 blocks. Set the pause value to 250 milliseconds.

trans-unit.source: Here is the full program:
trans-unit.target: Here is the full program:

trans-unit.source: basic.forever(() => { led.toggle(0, 2) led.toggle(4, 2) basic.pause(250) led.toggle(0, 3) led.toggle(4, 3) }) led.plot(1, 0) led.plot(3, 0) led.plot(2, 1) led.plot(1, 3) led.plot(2, 3) led.plot(3, 3)
trans-unit.target: basic.forever(() => { led.toggle(0, 2) led.toggle(4, 2) basic.pause(250) led.toggle(0, 3) led.toggle(4, 3) }) led.plot(1, 0) led.plot(3, 0) led.plot(2, 1) led.plot(1, 3) led.plot(2, 3) led.plot(3, 3)

trans-unit.source: Mod this!
trans-unit.target: Mod this!

trans-unit.source: Add a third image to the animation, perhaps a frown face.
trans-unit.target: Add a third image to the animation, perhaps a frown face.

trans-unit.source: Make your own custom animation! What LEDs stay the same and which need to be toggled?
trans-unit.target: Make your own custom animation! What LEDs stay the same and which need to be toggled?

trans-unit.source: Random patterns generator
trans-unit.target: Random patterns generator

trans-unit.source: A short exercise using a loop to generate random LED patterns and then checking the status of a specific LED.
trans-unit.target: A short exercise using a loop to generate random LED patterns and then checking the status of a specific LED.

trans-unit.source: Pseudocode: * On button A pressed we’ll use a loop to turn on a random set of LED lights on our micro:bit.
trans-unit.target: Pseudocode: * On Aボタン pressed we’ll use a loop to turn on a random set of LED lights on our micro:bit.

trans-unit.source: * Our display will have one LED lit for each column or x coordinate value from 0 through 4.
trans-unit.target: * Our display will have one LED lit for each column or ｘ座標 value from 0 through 4.

trans-unit.source: Steps: * From the Input Toolbox drawer, select the 'on button pressed' block * From the Basic - More Toolbox drawer, drop in a 'clear screen' block * From the Loops Toolbox drawer, drop in a 'for' block * From the LED Toolbox drawer, drop a 'plot x y' block * Use the variable 'index' for the x value * From the Math Toolbox drawer, drop a 'pick random' block into the y value
trans-unit.target: Steps: * From the 入力(Input)メニュー, select the 'on button pressed' block * From the Basic - More Toolbox drawer, drop in a 「表示を消す（clear screen）」 block * From the ループ(Loops)メニュー, drop in a 'for' block * From the LEDメニュー, drop a 'plot x y' block * Use the variable 'index' for the x value * From the 計算(Math)メニュー, drop a 「０～４の範囲の乱数（pick random）」 block into the y value

trans-unit.source: Check the on/off state of an LED
trans-unit.target: Check the on/off state of an LED

trans-unit.source: On button B pressed we’ll use an 'if...then...else' block from the Logic Toolbox drawer
trans-unit.target: On Bボタン pressed we’ll use an 「もし・・・なら・・・でなければ（if...then...else）」 block from the 論理(Logic)メニュー

trans-unit.source: From the LED Toolbox drawer, drop a 'point x y' block into the 'if' condition to check the current on/off state of a specific LED.
trans-unit.target: From the LEDメニュー, drop a 「点灯かどうか調べる（point x y）」 block into the 'if' condition to check the current on/off state of a specific LED.

trans-unit.source: If the LED is currently on, the point x y block will return true.
trans-unit.target: If the LED is currently on, the point x y block will return true.

trans-unit.source: If the LED is currently off, the point x y block will return false.
trans-unit.target: If the LED is currently off, the point x y block will return false.

trans-unit.source: For this exercise, we’ll use the two Yes/No built in icons to display the LED’s current status.
trans-unit.target: For this exercise, we’ll use the two Yes/No built in icons to display the LED’s current status.

trans-unit.source: From the Basic Toolbox drawer, drag 2 'show icon' blocks into each of the 'then' and 'else' clauses.
trans-unit.target: From the 基本（Basic）メニュー, drag 2 「アイコンを表示（show icon）」 blocks into each of the 'then' and 'else' clauses.

trans-unit.source: Select the check mark for Yes, and the X icon for No.
trans-unit.target: Select the check mark for Yes, and the X icon for No.

trans-unit.source: For now, we’ll leave the default coordinate values (0,0). But you can challenge your students to add a loop to test for all coordinates on the micro:bit.
trans-unit.target: For now, we’ll leave the default coordinate values (0,0). But you can challenge your students to add a loop to test for all coordinates on the micro:bit.

trans-unit.source: Here is the complete program:
trans-unit.target: 完全なプログラムはこのようになっているはずです。

trans-unit.source: Try it out!
trans-unit.target: Try it out!

trans-unit.source: Download the program to your micro:bit
trans-unit.target: Download the program to your micro:bit

trans-unit.source: Press button A to create a random pattern
trans-unit.target: Press Aボタン to create a random pattern

trans-unit.source: Press button B to check and display the status of the specific LED
trans-unit.target: Press Bボタン to check and display the status of the specific LED

trans-unit.source: Brightness
trans-unit.target: Brightness

trans-unit.source: A short exercise in using the brightness settings for the micro:bit LEDs.
trans-unit.target: A short exercise in using the brightness settings for the micro:bit LEDs.

trans-unit.source: Important to note - the brightness level of the micro:bit simulator LEDs will NOT appear to change!
trans-unit.target: Important to note - the brightness level of micro:bit シミュレーター LEDs will NOT appear to change!

trans-unit.source: You must run your program on the actual micro:bit to see the different brightness levels.
trans-unit.target: You must run your program on the actual micro:bit to see the different brightness levels.

trans-unit.source: We will check on, and numerically display the brightness level with our program, so we can verify with the simulator that it is working.
trans-unit.target: We will check on, and numerically display the brightness level with our program, so we can verify with シミュレーター that it is working.

trans-unit.source: Pseudocode: We’ll set the brightness level for the LEDs to the highest level on start and then use on button A pressed to decrease the brightness level and on button B pressed to increase the brightness level.
trans-unit.target: Pseudocode: We’ll set the brightness level for the LEDs to the highest level on start and then use on Aボタン pressed to decrease the brightness level and on Bボタン pressed to increase the brightness level.

trans-unit.source: We’ll use on button A+B pressed to check and display numerically the current brightness level.
trans-unit.target: We’ll use on AボタンとBボタン pressed to check and display numerically the current brightness level.

trans-unit.source: Steps:
trans-unit.target: Steps:

trans-unit.source: Drag 3 'set brightness' blocks and 3 'brightness' blocks from the Led - More Toolbox drawer onto your coding workspace
trans-unit.target: Drag 3 「明るさを設定する（set brightness）」 blocks and 3 「明るさ（brightness）」 blocks from the Led - More Toolbox drawer onto コーディング ワークスペース

trans-unit.source: Place one 'set brightness' block in the 'on start' block
trans-unit.target: Place one 「明るさを設定する（set brightness）」 block in the 「最初だけ（on start）」 block

trans-unit.source: Add a 'show icon' block after the 'set brightness' block so we will have an image to look at
trans-unit.target: Add a 「アイコンを表示（show icon）」 block after the 「明るさを設定する（set brightness）」 block so we will have 画像 to look at

trans-unit.source: led.setBrightness(255) basic.showIcon(IconNames.Heart)
trans-unit.target: led.setBrightness(255) basic.showIcon(IconNames.Heart)

trans-unit.source: From the Input Toolbox drawer, drag out 3 'on button pressed' blocks onto your coding workspace
trans-unit.target: From the 入力(Input)メニュー, drag out 3 'on button pressed' blocks onto コーディング ワークスペース

trans-unit.source: Leave one 'on button pressed' block with the default setting of A and change the second one to B and the third one to A+B
trans-unit.target: Leave one 'on button pressed' block with the default setting of A and change the second one to B and the third one to A+B

trans-unit.source: Place one 'set brightness' block in the 'on button A' pressed block, and the other 'set brightness' block in the 'on button B' pressed block
trans-unit.target: Place one 「明るさを設定する（set brightness）」 block in the 'on button A' pressed block, and the other 「明るさを設定する（set brightness）」 block in the 'on Bボタン' pressed block

trans-unit.source: From the Math Toolbox drawer, drag out an addition block and a subtraction block
trans-unit.target: From the 計算(Math)メニュー, drag out an 足し算ブロック and 足し算ブロック

trans-unit.source: Place the addition block within the 'set brightness' block in the 'on button B pressed' block
trans-unit.target: Place the 足し算ブロック within the 「明るさを設定する（set brightness）」 block in the 'on Bボタン pressed' block

trans-unit.source: Place the subtraction block within the 'set brightness' block in the 'on button A pressed' block
trans-unit.target: Place the 足し算ブロック within the 「明るさを設定する（set brightness）」 block in the 「ボタンAが押されたとき（on button A pressed）」 block

trans-unit.source: Place a 'brightness' block on the left side of each math expression
trans-unit.target: Place a 「明るさ（brightness）」 block on the left side of each math expression

trans-unit.source: Change the default value of 0 on the right side of each math expression to 25
trans-unit.target: Change the default value of 0 on the right side of each math expression to 25

trans-unit.source: Since we cannot see if our program is working in the simulator, let’s add a check into our code.
trans-unit.target: Since we cannot see if our program is working in シミュレーター, let’s add a check into our code.

trans-unit.source: On button A+B pressed, we’ll clear the screen and get and display the current brightness level as a number.
trans-unit.target: On AボタンとBボタン pressed, we’ll clear 画面 and get and display the current brightness level as a number.

trans-unit.source: Then we’ll re-display the image we used on start.
trans-unit.target: Then we’ll re-display 画像 we used on start.

trans-unit.source: Here is the complete program:
trans-unit.target: 完全なプログラムはこのようになっているはずです。

trans-unit.source: Try it out!
trans-unit.target: Try it out!

trans-unit.source: What happens if adding 25 or subtracting 25 from the current brightness level would result in a sum or difference outside of the 0 to 255 brightness range?
trans-unit.target: What happens if adding 25 or subtracting 25 from the current brightness level would result in a sum or difference outside of the 0 to 255 brightness range?
